org.dockbox.selene.api.entities

Interface Entity<T extends Entity<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of Entity
    All Superinterfaces:
    Identifiable, KeyHolder<T>, Locatable, PersistentDataHolder, Target
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ArmorStand, ItemFrame
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Player, SpongeArmorStand, SpongeEntity, SpongeGenericEntity, SpongeItemFrame, SpongePlayer

    public interface Entity<T extends Entity<T>>
extends Identifiable, Locatable, PersistentDataHolder, KeyHolder<T>
    An entity is a Minecraft entity.

    Examples of entities include:

    • Zombies
    • Sheep
    • Players
    • Dropped items
    • Dropped experience points
    • etc.

    Blocks and items (when they are in inventories) are not entities.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double DEFAULT_MAX_HEALTH

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_MAX_HEALTH

        static final double DEFAULT_MAX_HEALTH
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getDisplayName

        Text getDisplayName()
        Gets the display name of the entity. If no display name is present, an empty Text instance is returned.
        Returns:
        The display name of the entity, or an empty Text instance.

      • setDisplayName

        void setDisplayName(Text displayName)
        Sets the display name of the entity.
        Parameters:
        displayName - The display name of the entity.

      • getHealth

        double getHealth()
        Gets the current health of the entity in the form of the total HP.
        Returns:
        The current health of the entity.

      • setHealth

        void setHealth(double health)
        Sets the health of the entity in the form of the total HP. If the given value is higher than the maximum health of the entity, the maximum health is applied instead.
        Parameters:
        health - The new health of the entity.

      • isAlive

        boolean isAlive()
        Indicates whether the entity is alive inside a World.
        Returns:
        true if the entity is alive and loaded in a world, else false.

      • isInvisible

        boolean isInvisible()
        Indicates whether the entity is invisible.
        Returns:
        true if the entity is invisible, else false

      • setInvisible

        void setInvisible(boolean visible)
        Sets whether the entity should be invisible. Depending on the type of entity, inventory items may still be visible (e.g. armor, held items, etc).
        Parameters:
        visible - Whether the entity should be visible.

      • isInvulnerable

        boolean isInvulnerable()
        Indicates whether the entity is invulnerable. This protects the entity from being damaged by other entities, explosions, etc. However it does not protect it from being affected by setHealth(double) and destroy().
        Returns:
        Whether the entity is invulnerable.

      • setInvulnerable

        void setInvulnerable(boolean invulnerable)
        Sets whether the entity should be invulnerable.
        Parameters:
        invulnerable - Whether the entity should be invulnerable.

      • hasGravity

        boolean hasGravity()
        Indicates whether the entity is affected by gravity.
        Returns:
        true if the entity is affected by gravity, or false.

      • setGravity

        void setGravity(boolean gravity)
        Sets whether the entity should be affected by gravity. If the entity does not support gravity physics, as seen in e.g. Item Frames, nothing is done.
        Parameters:
        gravity - Whether the entity should be affected by gravity.

      • summon

        default boolean summon()
        Summons the entity into a world. The location at which the entity is summoned is provided by its base Location, set during the creation of the entity.
        Returns:
        true if the entity was summoned successfully, else false.

      • summon

        boolean summon(Location location)
        Summons the entity at a given Location.
        Parameters:
        location - The location to summon the entity at.
        Returns:
        true if the entity was summoned successfully, else false.

      • destroy

        boolean destroy()
        Destroys (kills) the entity, removing it from the world. This prevents the entity from being summoned again through summon().
        Returns:
        true if the entity was destroyed successfully, else false.

      • copy

        T copy()
        Creates a copy of the entity, copying its default and custom data provided by Keys and PersistentDataKeys.
        Returns:
        The copy of the current entity.
